variations.name: The Hundred - Bent Knees Modification
instructions: Lie supine on mat with knees bent, feet flat on floor
Lift head and shoulders off mat, chin toward chest
Extend arms straight alongside body, palms down
Pump arms up and down in small, controlled movements
Inhale for 5 counts, exhale for 5 counts (10 cycles = 100)
Keep lower back pressed into mat, core engaged
Maintain neutral neck position, avoid straining
Focus on steady, rhythmic breathing throughout

variations.name: The Hundred - Tabletop Position
instructions: Lie supine, lift head and shoulders off mat
Bring knees to tabletop position (90-degree hip and knee angles)
Extend arms straight, hovering just above mat
Pump arms vigorously up and down, 2-3 inch range
Inhale for 5 arm pumps, exhale for 5 arm pumps
Keep shoulders relaxed, avoid tension in neck
Maintain stable tabletop position, core fully engaged
Complete 10 breathing cycles (100 total pumps)
Lower head and legs with control to finish

variations.name: The Hundred - Extended Legs
instructions: Lie supine, lift head and shoulders off mat
Extend legs to 45-degree angle (or lower if hamstring flexibility allows)
Keep legs together, toes pointed, inner thighs engaged
Extend arms straight alongside body, palms down
Pump arms with controlled, rhythmic movements
Maintain 45-degree leg angle throughout entire exercise
Inhale for 5 counts, exhale for 5 counts
Keep lower back pressed into mat - if it lifts, raise legs slightly
Complete 10 full breathing cycles (100 pumps total)
This variation requires strong core and hip flexor control

variations.name: The Hundred - With Double Leg Lower
instructions: Begin in extended legs position at 45 degrees
Start arm pumping and breathing rhythm
On each exhale, lower legs 5-10 degrees
On each inhale, return legs to 45 degrees
Maintain arm pumping throughout entire movement
Keep lower back pressed into mat at all times
If back lifts off mat, stop lowering and return to start
This advanced variation challenges core endurance significantly
Complete 10 breathing cycles with leg lowering
Requires exceptional core strength and control

variations.name: Roll Up - Assisted with Strap
instructions: Lie supine with legs extended, arms overhead holding strap or towel
Keep legs together, inner thighs engaged, toes pointed
Inhale to prepare, exhale and lift arms toward ceiling
Continue exhaling, articulating spine one vertebra at a time
Use strap to assist forward flexion if needed
Roll up to seated position, reaching forward over legs
Inhale at top, then exhale to roll back down vertebra by vertebra
Control the descent, don't collapse
Repeat 5-8 times, focusing on spinal articulation

variations.name: Roll Up - Standard
instructions: Lie supine, legs extended, arms reaching overhead
Keep legs together, inner thighs engaged, feet flexed
Inhale to prepare, exhale and lift arms toward ceiling
Continue exhaling, tuck chin and begin spinal articulation
Roll up one vertebra at a time: cervical, thoracic, lumbar
Keep legs grounded, avoid using momentum
Reach forward over legs in seated position, spine long
Inhale at top, maintaining length
Exhale to initiate roll down, reversing the articulation
Control each vertebra as you lower, don't collapse
Complete 8-10 repetitions with full control

variations.name: Roll Up - Single Leg Variation
instructions: Lie supine with one leg extended, one leg bent (foot on mat)
Arms reaching overhead, maintain neutral pelvis
Inhale to prepare, exhale and roll up with control
As you roll up, extend the bent leg to match the other
Both legs extended and together at seated position
Reach forward over extended legs, maintaining length
Inhale at top, then exhale to roll back down
As you roll down, bend one leg again to assist control
Alternate which leg is bent on each repetition
This variation challenges unilateral stability and control
Complete 6-8 repetitions, alternating legs

variations.name: Single Leg Stretch - Beginner
instructions: Lie supine, lift head and shoulders off mat
Bring both knees to chest, hands on knees
Extend right leg to tabletop (90-degree angle)
Keep left knee pulled in, right hand on left knee, left hand on left ankle
Switch legs: extend left leg, pull right knee in
Keep head lifted, shoulders relaxed, core engaged
Move with control, don't rush the switching
Breathe naturally, maintain steady rhythm
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side
Focus on stability of torso while legs move

variations.name: Single Leg Stretch - Standard
instructions: Lie supine, lift head and shoulders off mat
Bring both knees to chest, maintaining C-curve of spine
Extend right leg to 45-degree angle (or lower if control allows)
Keep left knee pulled in, right hand on left knee, left hand on left shin
Switch legs with controlled movement: extend left, pull right in
Maintain stable torso - no rocking or momentum
Keep lower back pressed into mat throughout
Head stays lifted, gaze toward knees
Breathe: exhale on switch, inhale to hold
Complete 10-12 repetitions per side
Focus on precision and control over speed

variations.name: Single Leg Stretch - Double Pump
instructions: Begin in standard single leg stretch position
Extend right leg to 45 degrees, left knee pulled in
Perform two small pumps with the extended leg (flex and point foot)
Then switch legs: extend left, pull right in
Perform two pumps with new extended leg
Continue alternating with double pump on each extension
Maintain stable torso throughout - no movement in upper body
Keep lower back pressed into mat, core fully engaged
The double pump challenges stability and coordination
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side with double pumps
This advanced variation requires exceptional core control

variations.name: Swan Dive - Preparation (Swan)
instructions: Lie prone on mat, legs together, arms bent with hands by shoulders
Press palms into mat, keeping elbows close to body
Inhale and lift head, chest, and upper torso off mat
Keep pubic bone pressed into mat, avoid compressing lower back
Lengthen through crown of head, gaze forward or slightly up
Engage glutes and hamstrings to support back extension
Hold for 3-5 breaths, maintaining length
Exhale to lower with control, vertebra by vertebra
Repeat 5-8 times, building back extension strength
Focus on length over height in the extension

variations.name: Swan Dive - Standard
instructions: Begin in prone position, hands by shoulders
Inhale and lift into swan position (upper body extended)
From swan, lift legs off mat, engaging glutes and hamstrings
Balance on pubic bone, creating a 'flying' position
Keep arms extended forward or alongside body
Maintain length through entire spine, avoid compression
Hold for 2-3 breaths in the 'dive' position
Exhale to lower legs, then upper body with control
Repeat 6-8 times, focusing on smooth transitions
This exercise requires strong posterior chain activation
Keep neck long, avoid hyperextension

variations.name: Swan Dive - Rocking Variation
instructions: Begin in standard swan dive position (flying)
From balanced position, rock forward and back
Rock forward: lift chest and legs higher, balance on lower ribs/upper abdomen
Rock back: shift weight toward pubic bone, maintain extension
Keep arms extended, use them to help control the rocking motion
Maintain spinal extension throughout entire rocking movement
Rock smoothly, 5-8 times forward and back
This advanced variation requires exceptional back strength and control
Focus on fluid movement, not jerky motions
Finish by lowering legs, then upper body with control
Only attempt if standard swan dive is mastered

variations.name: Teaser - Preparation (Roll Back)
instructions: Sit tall with knees bent, feet flat on mat
Arms extended forward at shoulder height
Inhale to prepare, exhale and roll back vertebra by vertebra
Roll back until you feel abdominal engagement, but maintain balance
Keep knees together, maintain C-curve of spine
Inhale at bottom, then exhale to roll back up to seated
Use abdominals to control the movement, not momentum
Repeat 8-10 times, building core strength and control
This preparation builds the strength needed for full teaser
Focus on spinal articulation and core engagement

variations.name: Teaser - Single Leg
instructions: Lie supine, one leg extended, one leg bent (foot on mat)
Arms extended overhead, maintaining neutral spine
Inhale to prepare, exhale and roll up to seated position
As you roll up, extend the bent leg to match the other
Both legs extended at 45-degree angle, arms parallel to legs
Balance in V-sit position, maintaining C-curve
Hold for 2-3 breaths, maintaining balance and control
Exhale to roll back down, bending one leg to assist
Alternate which leg is bent on each repetition
Complete 6-8 repetitions, focusing on control over height
This variation builds toward full double-leg teaser

variations.name: Teaser - Full (Double Leg)
instructions: Lie supine with both legs extended together
Arms extended overhead, maintaining length through body
Inhale to prepare, exhale and roll up vertebra by vertebra
Simultaneously lift legs to meet torso in V-sit position
Balance on sit bones, legs at 45-degree angle (or higher)
Arms parallel to legs, maintaining C-curve of spine
Hold balanced position for 3-5 breaths
Exhale to roll back down with control, lowering legs simultaneously
Keep legs together throughout entire movement
This is one of Pilates' most advanced exercises
Requires exceptional core strength, balance, and flexibility
Complete 4-6 repetitions with full control
Focus on precision and control over achieving extreme angles

variations.name: Double Leg Stretch - Beginner
instructions: Lie supine, lift head and shoulders off mat
Bring both knees to chest, hands on knees
Inhale and extend arms overhead, legs to tabletop
Exhale and circle arms wide, bringing knees back to chest
Keep head lifted throughout movement
Maintain C-curve of spine, core engaged
Move with control, coordinating breath with movement
Complete 8-10 repetitions

variations.name: Double Leg Stretch - Standard
instructions: Lie supine, lift head and shoulders off mat
Bring both knees to chest, maintaining C-curve
Inhale and extend arms overhead, legs to 45 degrees
Exhale and circle arms wide, bringing knees back to chest
Keep lower back pressed into mat throughout
Coordinate breath with movement precisely
Maintain stable torso, no rocking
Complete 10-12 repetitions

variations.name: Double Leg Stretch - Extended Legs
instructions: Begin in standard position
Extend legs lower (30-45 degrees) while extending arms
Maintain core engagement and lower back connection
Circle arms wider for greater challenge
Keep legs straight and together
Coordinate breath precisely with movement
Complete 8-10 repetitions with full control

variations.name: Criss Cross - Beginner
instructions: Lie supine, lift head and shoulders off mat
Bring both knees to chest, hands behind head
Extend right leg to tabletop, rotate left shoulder toward right knee
Switch: extend left leg, rotate right shoulder toward left knee
Keep elbows wide, avoid pulling on neck
Maintain core engagement throughout
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side

variations.name: Criss Cross - Standard
instructions: Lie supine, lift head and shoulders off mat
Bring both knees to chest, hands behind head
Extend right leg to 45 degrees, rotate left shoulder toward right knee
Switch legs and rotation with controlled movement
Focus on spinal rotation, not just shoulder movement
Keep lower back pressed into mat
Complete 10-12 repetitions per side

variations.name: Criss Cross - Extended Legs
instructions: Begin in standard position
Extend legs lower (30-45 degrees) while rotating
Increase rotation range with extended legs
Maintain core stability throughout rotation
Keep lower back connected to mat
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side

variations.name: Scissors - Beginner
instructions: Lie supine, lift head and shoulders off mat
Bring both legs to tabletop position
Hold right leg with both hands, extend left leg toward ceiling
Switch legs in scissor motion
Keep head lifted, core engaged
Maintain stable torso throughout
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side

variations.name: Scissors - Standard
instructions: Lie supine, lift head and shoulders off mat
Bring both legs to tabletop
Hold right leg with both hands, extend left leg toward ceiling
Switch legs in controlled scissor motion
Keep legs straight, toes pointed
Maintain lower back connection to mat
Complete 10-12 repetitions per side

variations.name: Scissors - Double Pump
instructions: Begin in standard scissors position
Perform two small pumps with extended leg before switching
Maintain stable torso throughout double pump
Switch legs and repeat double pump
Requires exceptional core control and hamstring flexibility
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side

variations.name: Bicycle - Beginner
instructions: Lie supine, lift head and shoulders off mat
Bring both knees to chest, hands behind head
Extend right leg, bring left knee in, rotate right shoulder toward left knee
Switch: extend left leg, bring right knee in, rotate left shoulder toward right knee
Keep elbows wide, move with control
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side

variations.name: Bicycle - Standard
instructions: Lie supine, lift head and shoulders off mat
Bring both knees to chest, hands behind head
Extend right leg to 45 degrees, bring left knee in
Rotate right shoulder toward left knee with spinal rotation
Switch sides with controlled movement
Focus on rotation through spine, not just shoulders
Complete 10-12 repetitions per side

variations.name: Bicycle - Extended Legs
instructions: Begin in standard position
Extend working leg lower (30-45 degrees)
Increase rotation range with extended leg
Maintain core stability and lower back connection
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side

variations.name: Shoulder Bridge - Basic
instructions: Lie supine with knees bent, feet flat on mat
Arms alongside body, palms down
Inhale to prepare, exhale and lift hips off mat
Lift vertebra by vertebra until body forms straight line
Hold for 2-3 breaths, engaging glutes and hamstrings
Lower with control, vertebra by vertebra
Complete 8-10 repetitions

variations.name: Shoulder Bridge - Single Leg
instructions: Begin in basic bridge position
Lift one leg, extending it toward ceiling
Maintain bridge height with supporting leg
Keep hips level, avoid tilting
Hold for 2-3 breaths, then lower leg
Alternate legs, complete 6-8 repetitions per side

variations.name: Shoulder Bridge - Marching
instructions: Begin in basic bridge position
Lift one foot off mat, bringing knee toward chest
Return foot to mat, lift opposite foot
Continue marching motion while maintaining bridge
Keep hips level and stable throughout
Complete 10-12 repetitions per side

variations.name: Shoulder Bridge - Leg Lift
instructions: Begin in basic bridge position
Lift one leg and extend it straight toward ceiling
Lower leg with control, keeping bridge height
Alternate legs, maintaining stable bridge
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side

variations.name: Spine Stretch Forward - Seated
instructions: Sit tall with legs extended, feet flexed
Arms extended forward at shoulder height
Inhale to lengthen spine, exhale and articulate forward
Roll forward vertebra by vertebra
Reach forward over legs, maintaining length
Inhale at bottom, exhale to roll back up
Complete 8-10 repetitions

variations.name: Spine Stretch Forward - Deep
instructions: Sit tall with legs extended, feet flexed
Arms extended forward at shoulder height
Inhale to lengthen, exhale and roll forward deeply
Reach further forward, increasing hamstring stretch
Maintain spinal articulation throughout
Complete 8-10 repetitions with full range

variations.name: Spine Stretch Forward - Single Leg
instructions: Sit with one leg extended, one leg bent (foot on mat)
Arms extended forward
Roll forward over extended leg
Switch legs and repeat
Complete 6-8 repetitions per side

variations.name: Saw - Basic
instructions: Sit tall with legs extended wide, feet flexed
Arms extended to sides at shoulder height
Rotate torso to right, reach left hand toward right foot
Saw motion: reach further with each exhale
Return to center, rotate to left side
Complete 6-8 repetitions per side

variations.name: Saw - Deep Rotation
instructions: Sit tall with legs extended wide
Increase rotation range, reaching further
Deepen saw motion with each repetition
Maintain spinal length throughout rotation
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side

variations.name: Saw - Single Leg
instructions: Sit with one leg extended, one leg bent
Perform saw motion over extended leg
Switch legs and repeat
Complete 6-8 repetitions per side

variations.name: Swimming - Basic
instructions: Lie prone, arms extended overhead, legs together
Lift opposite arm and leg simultaneously
Lower and lift opposite side
Create swimming motion with arms and legs
Keep head in neutral position
Complete 10-12 repetitions per side

variations.name: Swimming - Standard
instructions: Lie prone, arms extended overhead
Lift opposite arm and leg higher
Increase range of motion in swimming motion
Maintain length through spine
Complete 12-15 repetitions per side

variations.name: Swimming - Double Lift
instructions: Begin in standard position
Lift both arms and both legs simultaneously
Hold briefly, then lower
Repeat with controlled movement
Requires exceptional back strength
Complete 8-10 repetitions

variations.name: Leg Pull Front - Basic
instructions: Start in plank position, hands under shoulders
Lift one leg, extending it straight back
Lower leg with control
Alternate legs, maintaining plank position
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side

variations.name: Leg Pull Front - Extended Hold
instructions: Start in plank position
Lift one leg and hold extended for 3-5 breaths
Lower with control, lift opposite leg
Maintain stable plank throughout
Complete 6-8 repetitions per side

variations.name: Leg Pull Front - Alternating
instructions: Start in plank position
Alternate lifting legs in quick succession
Maintain plank stability throughout
Complete 12-15 repetitions per side

variations.name: Side Kicks - Basic
instructions: Lie on side, bottom arm supporting head, top hand on mat
Lift top leg to hip height, kick forward and back
Keep leg straight, toes pointed
Maintain stable torso throughout
Complete 10-12 repetitions per side

variations.name: Side Kicks - Circles
instructions: Lie on side in basic position
Lift top leg and make small circles forward
Reverse direction, making circles backward
Keep torso stable, leg moving independently
Complete 8-10 circles each direction per side

variations.name: Side Kicks - Lifts
instructions: Lie on side in basic position
Lift top leg as high as possible
Lower with control, maintaining height
Focus on hip abductor engagement
Complete 10-12 repetitions per side

variations.name: Mermaid - Basic
instructions: Sit on side with legs bent to one side
Bottom arm extended on mat, top arm overhead
Lateral flex spine, reaching top arm to side
Return to center with control
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side

variations.name: Mermaid - Deep Lateral Flexion
instructions: Sit on side with legs bent
Increase lateral flexion range
Reach top arm further to side
Deepen stretch with each repetition
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side

variations.name: Mermaid - Extended
instructions: Sit on side with legs extended to one side
Perform lateral flexion with extended legs
Increases challenge and range of motion
Complete 6-8 repetitions per side

variations.name: Seal - Basic
instructions: Sit with knees bent, feet together, hands holding ankles
Roll back onto shoulders, balancing on sit bones
Roll forward to seated position
Maintain balance and control throughout
Complete 8-10 repetitions

variations.name: Seal - Extended
instructions: Begin in basic seal position
Extend legs further, increasing balance challenge
Roll back and forward with greater range
Maintain control and balance
Complete 8-10 repetitions

variations.name: Seal - Clapping
instructions: Begin in seal position
Clap feet together while balancing
Maintain balance during clapping motion
Complete 10-12 repetitions

variations.name: Corkscrew - Basic
instructions: Lie supine, arms alongside body
Lift both legs to 90 degrees
Circle legs in one direction, maintaining control
Reverse direction, circling opposite way
Keep lower back pressed into mat
Complete 6-8 circles each direction

variations.name: Corkscrew - Extended
instructions: Begin in basic position
Lower legs to 45 degrees while circling
Increase circle size and range
Maintain core control throughout
Complete 8-10 circles each direction

variations.name: Corkscrew - Single Leg
instructions: Lie supine, lift one leg to 90 degrees
Circle leg in one direction
Reverse direction, then switch legs
Complete 6-8 circles per leg each direction

variations.name: Jackknife - Basic
instructions: Lie supine, arms alongside body
Lift both legs toward ceiling
Lift hips off mat, bringing legs over head
Lower with control, vertebra by vertebra
Complete 6-8 repetitions

variations.name: Jackknife - Extended
instructions: Begin in basic position
Extend legs further over head
Increase range of motion
Maintain control throughout
Complete 6-8 repetitions

variations.name: Jackknife - Single Leg
instructions: Lie supine, lift one leg toward ceiling
Lift hips, bringing leg over head
Lower with control, switch legs
Complete 6-8 repetitions per side
